newsitem.title: INDIA: Six wounded in Kashmir grenade attack.
newsitem.headline: Six wounded in Kashmir grenade attack.

text.p: A grenade attack in Kashmir wounded at least six people at a busy marketplace on Thursday, police said.
Suspected separatist guerrillas lobbed a hand grenade at a paramilitary patrol in the crowded Lal Chowk area of Srinagar, the summer capital of India's Jammu and Kashmir state, police said.
The grenade missed its target and exploded on the road, wounding six pedestrians, they said. No group has claimed responsibility.
More than a dozen militant groups are waging a separatist rebellion in Jammu and Kashmir, mainly Hindu India's only Moslem-majority province.
Police and hospitals say more than 20,000 people have been killed since the revolt in the Himalayan region broke out in 1990.
